PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Lois Swope, 3101 Iowa Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 18, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think that refuse drivers and collectors should be tipped at Christmas time? Is service affected if they are not?" answer reads: "Yes, I think that they should have tips for the service which they give during the year.  However, I don't think that service is affected if they are not tipped."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lois Swope wearing plaid scarf, light colored coat, and dark knit gloves, standing with reporter holding notepad, on brick street with car with licence plate "DP-9020", and building with "Prescriptions" sign and Tucker Ale billboard
